raw_text: include (Utiyama and Isahara, 2003), who use cross-language information retrieval techniques and dynamic programming to extract sentences from an English-Japanese comparable corpus. They identify similar article pairs, and then, treating these pairs as parallel texts, align their sentences on a sentence pair similarity score and used P to find the least-cost alignment over the document pair
clean_text: Works aimed at discovering parallel sentences include (Utiyama and Isahara, 2003), who use cross-language information retrieval techniques and dynamic programming to extract sentences from an English-Japanese comparable corpus.

raw_text: 4.2 Prior Model I. Prior for Exhaustive Alignment Space IBM Models 1 and 2 implement a prior for all possible 3Unlike other language pairs, the availability of Japanese? English parallel corpora is quite limited: the NT CIR patent corpus (Fujii et al, 2010) of 3 million sentence pairs (the latest NTCIR-8 version) for the patent domain andJENAAD corpus (Utiyama and Isahara, 2003) of 150k sentence pairs for the news domain
clean_text: Unlike other language pairs, the availability of Japanese-English parallel corpora is quite limited: the NTCIR patent corpus (Fujii et al, 2010) of 3 million sentence pairs (the latest NTCIR-8 version) for the patent domain and JENAAD corpus (Utiyama and Isahara, 2003) of 150k sentence pairs for the news domain.
